pullRequest.body:
More precisely, for a fiber functor `F`, the induced functor to the category of finite `Aut F`-sets is full.

---

### PR summary [7fd198c67f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16478/commits/7fd198c67f4cbe7529373c1bcc48cde67a3c0842)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.CategoryTheory.Galois.Full`|1071|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ exists_lift_of_mono`
`+ exists_lift_of_mono_of_isConnected`
`+ functorToAction`
`+ functorToAction_comp_forget₂_eq`
`+ functorToAction_full`
`+ instance : FiberFunctor (forget₂ (Action FintypeCat (MonCat.of G)) FintypeCat)`
`+ instance : Functor.Faithful (functorToAction F)`
`+ instance : Functor.ReflectsIsomorphisms (functorToAction F)`
`+ instance : PreservesFiniteCoproducts (functorToAction F)`
`+ instance : PreservesFiniteProducts (functorToAction F)`
`+ instance : PreservesIsConnected (functorToAction F)`
`+ instance : PreservesMonomorphisms (functorToAction F)`
`+ instance : ReflectsMonomorphisms (functorToAction F) := reflectsMonomorphisms_of_faithful _`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Thanks for the review @callesonne, I addressed your suggestions in the latest commit.

Thanks!

bors d+

:v: chrisflav can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks for the reviews!

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10789851681/job/29923729888)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10789851681/job/29923730810)
LGTM!
LGTM!
Has `lift_subobjects` been renamed to `exists_lift_of_mono`?
Yes it has, good catch!

```suggestion
    rw [← Iso.inv_comp_eq]
```

```suggestion
  refine ⟨∐ gZ, Sigma.desc gf, t.symm ≪≫ u' ≪≫ is2.symm, ?_, by simp [heq]⟩
  · exact mono_of_mono_map (functorToAction F) (heq ▸ mono_comp _ _)
```
I prefer this, but it's not a big deal, so do whatever you like.

```suggestion
    have : Mono i := by
      have : Mono (u ≫ prod.fst) := prod.lift_fst (𝟙 _) f ▸ inferInstance
      have : Mono u := mono_of_mono u prod.fst
      apply mono_comp u _
```
This is a really cool proof!

It seems that previously in this file you've used `Action.forget`, and now you are using `forget₂`. Is there a reason for using both? Or can the previous instances in this file be rewritten to only use `forget₂`?

Things about the `Action` category tend to be stated for `Action.forget` since it is more general (it does not assume the base category to be a `ConcreteCategory`), while `forget₂` needs the base category to be concrete. In this case, `FintypeCat` is concrete, so also `forget₂` can be used (and I think that every statement about `Action.forget` should be mirrored for `forget₂` in other places of mathlib too, but currently that is not the case, so using `Action.forget` in proofs is working more smoothly).
Are you not showing it is fully faithful?
Well yes, but the faithfulness is easy and is essentially done in the `Basic` file. So this file is really about the `Full` part. Should I change the wording?
Yes, I think you should say that the fiber functors are actually fully faithful by the top of the file.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Galois): any fiber functor of a Galois category is full
